snippet: Major credit agencies are increasingly reporting the amount of borrowers’ payments, which experts say could soon be used in calculating credit risk.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column; major credit agencies are increasingly reporting amount of borrowers’ payments, which experts say could soon be used in calculating credit risk; it remains to be seen if extra information on when and how consumers pay debts over time will ultimately have broad impact on credit scores.
lead_paragraph: Major credit agencies are increasingly reporting the amount of borrowers’ payments, which experts say could soon be used in calculating credit risk.

headline.main: For Better Credit Score, Max Out Payments, Not the Card
